phrase.item: In the dark night you are the brightest star
In your world I am the saddest one.
In the dark night you are the brightest star.
In your world I am the saddest one.
Come and see me some time.
My beautiful violet flower.
Come and see me some time.
My beautiful violet flower.
Oh the mirror of my door,
I stare at your pathway.
Oh the mirror of my door,
I stare at your pathway
I see no sign of your arrival.
Oh, my beautiful violet flower.
I see no sign of your arrival.
Oh, my beautiful violet flower.
You keep teasing, keeping yourself busy.
My life will be over [by the time you come].
You keep teasing, keeping yourself busy.
My life will be over [by the time you come].
You will loose the faithful Bulbul,
my beautiful violet flower.
You will loose the faithful Bulbul,
My beautiful violet flower.
I just sang a song of Nazir Ahmad Bulbul.
I hope you liked it.
Nazir Ahmad Bulbul has sung [and created] very nice songs. I have been inspired by him for a long time.
So, because of that whenever I used to go anywhere, to university or other programs, I used to participate and sing his songs.
In our area any languages we speak those [languages] I share with people.

So, even today I am in New York, I thought we also have our people here, as well outside people [speakers of different languages] are here, the culture and traditions we have, I share them with them. For that reason I recorded these [songs].
Before this, as in our culture, only men used to sing.
Women did not have opportunities, they were not allowed to [to sing].

However, I am very happy in Gulmit [Pakistan] with the help of USAID, there is our Al-Amin school, they have opened a music school [classes] called "Bilbilik". Our daughters attend that [school], they sing songs, our sons... This is a very good opportunity for them to move our culture forward.
And I hope that women together with men can move forward equally, [which we can only do] if we overcome the burden of this [stereotyping] culture of ours.
It makes me really happy when I see and hear "bilbilik" or other kinds of songs, many times- I really like them.
Wherever our people are, when it comes to our culture, we never forget them. Because we were born and raised in that environment, We grew up in that environment and culture.
So, any place we go it exists in our blood, and in our bodies.
So we enjoy by talking in [our language] or hearing songs being sung.
That's why I said, okay, you should hear Bulbul's songs in New York as well.
That's why I shared these [songs].
